ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of knowledge
ResearchProjectDef.description: The start of a glorious journey through the ages. The key to unlocking the future, formed from one errant thought.

ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of curiosity
ResearchProjectDef.description: A good foundation has been set, and large strides have been made, such that most natural predators cannot threaten you on their own. But while these primitive tools are good, they simply are not good enough. Why be satisfied with mere wood, when there is a bounty of stone and metal to exploit instead?

ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of innovation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The bounty of the earth itself has been worked to your favor. Leaps and bounds of progress has been made for crafting and forging. However, the human mind and body can only go so far on its own. It is time to develop more advanced tools to assist with both production and data gathering.

ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of wonder
ResearchProjectDef.description: Harnessing the power of electricity has opened numerous horizons for development. But mere earthly ambitions are no longer enough. The stars themselves are now within reach. All you have to do is seize the opportunity.

ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of ingenuity
ResearchProjectDef.description: Further and further your ambition grows. Extraordinary technologies from various sources are now at your fingertips, including the secrets to space flight. But it's not enough. The secrets of the universe must be laid bare before you. Advanced bionics, exotic structures, perhaps even the inner workings of hulking mechanoids. Every morsel of information is fair game.

ResearchProjectDef.label: spark of ascension
ResearchProjectDef.description: Can one know the unknowable? Of course, the answer sounds obvious for an ordinary individual, but you are anything but ordinary.

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic structures
ResearchProjectDef.description: Enough of working while exposed to the elements. Why not indulge in some of the basics of construction: walls and supports. Quite simple, but they will protect you and hold up a roof well enough.

ResearchProjectDef.label: doors
ResearchProjectDef.description: The wall's more complex brother. Operating on hinges to swing open and closed allows people to enter and exit while fully sealing a room from the elements. A door is far more fragile than a regular wall, but that is the price of convenience.

ResearchProjectDef.label: animal husbandry
ResearchProjectDef.description: Certain types of animals cannot be left alone to wander around, unless you would like then to wander off. Building specialized pens and coops to contain them will keep your livestock in one place.

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic flooring
ResearchProjectDef.description: A roof over your head and walls keeping the outdoors out is all well and good, but there is still one side of a room unaccounted for: the floor. Instead of having filth crunching underneath you all the time, one can simply lay down some wooden planks to not only liven up the place, but also keep your base hygienic.

ResearchProjectDef.label: stone paths
ResearchProjectDef.description: Walking on natural terrain is slower than walking on manmade terrain. Creating pathways by haphazardly placing smooth rocks down is both a time and cost efficient method to connect buildings.

ResearchProjectDef.label: bridges
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unfortunately, certain terrain isn't stable enough for regular flooring. However, placing some sturdy supports in the ground allows for light flooring to be laid on such unstable areas, though it is a fair bit more expensive.

ResearchProjectDef.label: honor the dead
ResearchProjectDef.description: The idea of leaving the bodies of your fellow comrades just lying around seems... wrong. A final place of rest would be far better suited to honor their memory.

ResearchProjectDef.label: defensive cover
ResearchProjectDef.description: Standing out in the open during a firefight is unsafe, and naturally occurring cover is not guaranteed to be in an ideal location. The clear solution is to build your own.

ResearchProjectDef.label: modern cover
ResearchProjectDef.description: Standard barricades are slow to build, a fatal flaw if caught unawares. Sandbag fortifications are fast to assemble, ideal for setting up impromptu defenses or building a fortified bunker during offensive maneuvers.

ResearchProjectDef.label: traps
ResearchProjectDef.description: Direct confrontation in combat works well, but it can also result in great injury. While setting up enough traps to take out an entire army is unrealistic, a few well placed traps can remove enough hostiles to make the difference between a glorious victory and a crushing defeat.

ResearchProjectDef.label: firemaking
ResearchProjectDef.description: A cornerstone of technological advancement. Fire has a multitude of uses even for an unadvanced society, from safely preparing food to being used to inflict grievous wounds.

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic crafting
ResearchProjectDef.description: While hands are a quite versatile tool, they can only go so far when it comes to more complex tasks. It would be far more efficient to use those hands for creating tools that make working and killing easier.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive butchering
ResearchProjectDef.description: While eating raw corpses directly is... barely serviceable, it is highly nutrient inefficient and quite an unpleasant experience. It is far better to hew flesh from bone and properly butcher meat into separate chunks to either consume or prepare.

ResearchProjectDef.label: butchering
ResearchProjectDef.description: While properly butchering meat is a vast improvement over just eating a corpse directly, the process can still be refined. Simply pulling bodies apart with bare hands is both a tough and inefficient process. Creating a dedicated workbench equipped with proper tools is far better for harvesting as much meat as possible.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive cooking
ResearchProjectDef.description: Raw foodstuffs are both generally unpleasant to eat and have the rather unfortunate tendency to give its consumers a quite violent case of food poisoning. By cooking your food over a fire, you can both improve the taste and (hopefully) remove the chance of food poisoning.

ResearchProjectDef.label: food preparation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Cooking over an open flame is fine for basic food, but if you want to actually cook something decently complex, then a more sophisticated cooking station is needed.

ResearchProjectDef.label: record keeping
ResearchProjectDef.description: While thinking on top of a glorified stone chunk has provided a suitable spot for research up to now, just having various papers and blueprints in a jumbled pile will not cut it for more complex research projects. It's time to organize those documents, and get a larger workspace as well.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive melee weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: Normal human fists are a terrible weapon when it comes to melee combat. Even for a skilled fighter, they likely wouldn't be able to take out a dangerous enemy without sustaining heavy injury. Implements to amplify a person's lethal force is the answer. Even simple clubs and blades are far better than fighting barehanded.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive ranged weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: Melee is good for stopping enemies from moving, but the unskilled and the physically frail are ill-suited to such things. A safer and effective alternative is ranged combat. Simple bows and pilum are unwieldy and somewhat ineffective, but they have the range to stay out of harm's way of a fist or blade.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive clothing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Being naked is bad for temperature regulation and protection. Even some simple clothes made from stitched together hides and wood can both protect and insulate the wearer effectively.

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic furniture
ResearchProjectDef.description: While a room can protect you from the elements, it doesn't serve too much of a purpose if there isn't anything to put inside. Perhaps some basic amenities could remedy that.

ResearchProjectDef.label: bedrolls
ResearchProjectDef.description: Sleeping on the floor is quite literally a pain in the neck. And back. Using that relatively soft leather for a comfortable sleeping spot seems like a good fix.

ResearchProjectDef.label: artistry
ResearchProjectDef.description: While a basic hut can suffice for someone's basic needs, it is a bit dull. Letting a creatively inclined individual experiment with creating art could brighten the surroundings considerably.

ResearchProjectDef.label: recreational games
ResearchProjectDef.description: Basic meditation and conversation can only be so entertaining. Creating some games to play will offer a larger variety of entertainment.

ResearchProjectDef.label: wild plant cultivation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Running around the area to harvest food and medicine simply isn't practical. If you were to domesticate and grow them yourself, you could control the location of the plants you need.

ResearchProjectDef.label: agriculture
ResearchProjectDef.description: Cultivated wild plants for food are not sustainable for large groups of people. Growing more high yield plants is a far more viable way to feed a sizable colony.

ResearchProjectDef.label: smokeleaf
ResearchProjectDef.description: While plants for providing sustenance are important, they aren't exactly what a regular person would consider fun. What is fun, or at least isn't boring, is getting high. Smokeweed is a relatively safe recreational drug, perfect for improving morale with few medical ramifications, save for addiction. Just don't let someone with brain damage smoke it, or they might shut down their brain entirely.

ResearchProjectDef.label: psychoid
ResearchProjectDef.description: While plants for providing sustenance are important, they aren't exactly what a regular person would consider fun. What is fun, or at least isn't boring, is getting high. Psychoid takes a bit of effort to process into a usable drug, but has a variety of uses, from pleasure to medical.

ResearchProjectDef.label: cotton
ResearchProjectDef.description: Leather is tough, but can be hard to come by at times. Cotton, however, can be easily planted in large swathes to produce cloth. While cloth is less protective and insulating than most animal pelts, it has some specific uses that cannot be substituted by leather.
